alert.note: Alert for Adams; Buffalo; Juneau; Monroe; Trempealeau (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 27 at 5:25AM CST until February 27 at 12:00PM CST by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...Freezing Rain This Morning... .Freezing rain is quickly surging northeast across the area early this morning, and will move north of highway 29 in north-central Wisconsin before 7 am. Untreated surfaces, including roads and sidewalks, will quickly accrue ice. Warmer air is also moving north, which will help limit the amount of freezing rain that will impact a location. Currently, warmer air is expected to reach the I-94 corridor by 8 am. Additional icing should end there, but surfaces could still be icy. North of there, freezing rain could persist for most of the morning. There will be a change over to snow for the afternoon north of highway 29 in north-central Wisconsin, with 1 to 2 inch accumulations. Temperatures will play a key role in icing amounts. Small changes could result in substantial shifts in impacts. Pay close attention to the forecast for any revisions. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON CST TODAY... * WHAT...Freezing rain, mostly along and north of interstate 94. Ice accumulations from a glaze to as much as 2 tenths of an inch. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...Buffalo, Trempealeau, Monroe, Juneau and Adams Counties. * WHEN...Until noon CST today. * IMPACTS...Difficult travel conditions in some locations. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning commute.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Prepare for possible power outages. Visit 511wi.gov for road conditions.
